page.title: 09Horses and Riding 1
page.content: You will see many horses in this area. To the North ponies roam freely in the{New Forest.}All are owned by somebody and are branded with their owners' names. Owners pay a fee of Â£10 per year to the Agisters for grazing rights.The{ponies}are rounded up at various times of the year and official pony sales, a tourist attraction, take place near Beaulieu Station. Cattle grids mark the extremities of the New Forest to prevent the ponies straying on to private land or the busy mainroads. Many of the private houses in the area have{stables}attached,and it is a common sight to see horses munching in the paddocks and a horse box parked in the drive.Many farmers own horses or rent out fields for grazing. The sight of a pony and trap is still seen quite often between Sway & Lymington.
